author: Staff Reporter
text:
Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s voluntary meeting with Afsal Guru and Yakob Memon mirrored its tacit support to terrorism, said Bharatiya Janata Party leader L. Ganesan.

Talking press persons here on Monday, he said that several foreign countries that had differences of opinion on various issues allied together against anti-terrorists activities. But Leftists and the Congress, with an aim of acting against the PM, took supportive stand on terrorists.

Comments made by the DMDK leader Premalatha against DMK alliance with Congress indicated that the DMDK would not have alliance with the DMK in the Assembly election. The DMDK did not join hands with the DMK because the Congress was with it. Congress leader E.V.K.S Elangovan should realise it, he said.

Party leader Amit Sha would make an announcement about alliance in the State in five days. But the State BJP commenced its field work in all 234 constituencies. The weak TN Election Commission could not prevent distribution of money for votes. It had several hurdles in executing its work. The ‘Tirumangalam formula’ had become ‘Tamil Nadu formula.’ People should come forward voluntarily not to accept money for casting their votes, he said.

On People’s Welfare Front, he said that it was formed just for the campaign.
title: “Parties must unite against terrorism”
